intro: Gypsophila sambukii, commonly known as the Armenian baby's breath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white or pinkish clusters of small flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. It produces slender, branching stems with narrow leaves and blooms in late summer to early autumn. Gypsophila sambukii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
